faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Office Space For Rent in New Gurgaon
faqSection.description: Get detailed answers regarding lease agreements pricing models and commercial infrastructure in New Gurgaon business sectors.

faqs.question: What are the typical lease terms for office space in New Gurgaon commercial buildings
faqs.answer: Standard commercial leases in New Gurgaon generally range from three to nine years with common lock-in periods of three to five years. Shorter terms are usually reserved for co-working or serviced office setups while bare shell spaces require longer commitments due to significant fit-out costs incurred by the tenant or landlord. Lease agreements often include a rental escalation clause typically stipulating a 15 percent increase every three years to account for inflation and market appreciation.

faqs.question: How do common area maintenance CAM charges affect the total rental cost in New Gurgaon
faqs.answer: CAM charges are separate from the base rent and cover the costs associated with operating and maintaining shared areas of the commercial building such as lobbies elevators security common lighting and power backup generators. In New Gurgaon's premium buildings CAM charges can range significantly based on the level of amenity provided. It is crucial to clarify exactly what is included in the CAM charge before signing the lease to avoid unexpected quarterly costs.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a bare shell and a fully fitted office space rental
faqs.answer: A bare shell office space is delivered with only the basic structure perimeter walls and wet points typically without flooring ceilings internal partitions or electrical wiring ready for the tenant to customize entirely. A fully fitted office space also known as plug-and-play is ready for immediate occupation complete with furniture internal cabins meeting rooms lighting and air conditioning saving the incoming tenant substantial upfront capital investment and time.

faqs.question: Which sectors in New Gurgaon offer the best connectivity for staff commuting from Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Sectors along the Dwarka Expressway like Sector 83 and Sector 84 are highly favored for their direct connectivity to Gurgaon and proximity to the airport. Furthermore areas near the National Highway 48 corridor offer quick access to the main artery linking Gurgaon and Gurgaon making the commute easier for employees traveling from various parts of the NCR. Good public transport access like metro feeder buses should also be considered.

faqs.question: Are there tax benefits associated with renting a commercial office space in New Gurgaon
faqs.answer: Yes rent paid for a commercial office space is typically a deductible business expense under Indian tax laws reducing the taxable income for the company. Additionally businesses can claim depreciation on interior fit-outs and office equipment installed within the rented premises. It is highly recommended to consult with a qualified Chartered Accountant to maximize these legitimate tax advantages specific to your corporate structure.

faqs.question: What security deposits are usually required for commercial rentals in this area
faqs.answer: The standard security deposit for office space For Rent in New Gurgaon commercial buildings typically ranges from three to six months worth of the combined base rent and common area maintenance charges. This deposit is held by the landlord throughout the lease term and is usually refundable upon successful vacation of the premises provided there is no damage beyond standard wear and tear.

faqs.question: Can I sublet a portion of my office space to another company
faqs.answer: The ability to sublet depends entirely on the specific clauses within your commercial lease agreement. Most landlords restrict subleasing heavily especially in premium buildings to maintain control over the tenant mix and quality. If subletting is a requirement for your operational flexibility this must be explicitly negotiated and written into the lease terms prior to signing.

faqs.question: How soon can a company occupy a new bare shell office space after finalizing the lease
faqs.answer: Occupancy time for a bare shell space is driven by the fit-out timeline which can range from three to six months depending on the size complexity and required regulatory approvals. The lease usually includes a rent-free fit-out period negotiated with the landlord to cover this construction time before rental payments officially begin.

faqs.question: What is RERA's role in the commercial office space rental market in New Gurgaon
faqs.answer: While RERA Real Estate Regulatory Authority primarily focuses on residential sales its principles of transparency and project timeline adherence apply broadly to commercial developments. RERA registration ensures the project is legally sound and protects tenant interests regarding promised amenities and timely handover. Always verify that the building developer is compliant.

faqs.question: What are the essential infrastructure requirements for IT and tech companies in New Gurgaon office buildings
faqs.answer: IT and tech companies require robust infrastructure including 100 percent power backup redundancy dedicated high-speed fiber optic connectivity multiple telecom provider options and high floor-to-ceiling heights to accommodate heavy cabling and specialized cooling systems. Additionally advanced fire suppression and 24/7 access control security are non-negotiable requirements for secure data operations.
